Finding aid encoded by Valerie Higgins, Library/Archives, Indiana University, February 12, 2009

did.head: Summary Information
did.unittitle: Catbird Press mss.
did.abstract: The Catbird Press mss., ca. 1983-2003, consists primarily of the files of small, independent book publisher Catbird Press.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Catbird Press was founded in 1987 by Robert Wechsler for the purpose of publishing Czech literature in translation and sophisticated prose humor in the classic American tradition. American fiction was added to the line-up in 1991 and British fiction in 1999. Other titles include two non-fiction works relating to charitable giving and improving public schools, as well as Rob Wechsler's book about translating and translation: Performing Without a Stage: The Art of Literary Translation. Catbird Press books are distributed to bookstores and wholesalers by Independent Publishers Group, some records for which are present in the collection.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into the following series: I. Publications; II. Personal; III. Business/Office.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The Catbird Press mss., ca. 1983-2003, consists primarily of the files of small, independent book publisher Catbird Press. The Publications series includes correspondence with authors, translators and illustrators; drafts of books; promotion, sales and marketing, subsidiary rights and production materials; notes; reviews; as well as manuscripts of translations submitted to the Press that Catbird did not publish. The Personal series contains manuscripts and some correspondence relating to Wechsler's own writings such as book reviews, translations of Czech poems, and a long unpublished novel titled In Succession. Also present are his To Do sheets, vitae, and notebooks. The Business/Office series contains additional materials regarding general distribution, warehousing, trade shows, and other post-publication matters.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in IUCAT, the IU Libraries' online catalog. Materials about related topics, persons or places can be found by searching the catalog using these terms.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Catbird Press mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

did.unittitle: Publications

scopecontent.p: Interviews with Richard Pevear, Richard Wilbur, Richard Sieburth, Peter Glassgold, Harry Zohn, Eliot Weinberger, Anthony Rudolf, Breon Mitchell and Willis Barnstone, Arthur Goldhammer, Barbara and Benjamin Harshav, Gregory Rabassa, Krishna Winston, David Ball, William Weaver, Katherine Washburn, Karen Brazell, Barbara Wright, Ronnie Apter, Gordon Fielder, Frank Günther, Jilly Paver, Klaus Reichert, Martin Hilsky, Jean-Michel Déprats.

Speeches and panels at American Literary Translators Association conferences in 1994 and 1995: Carol Maier, Breon Mitchell, Michael Heim, Magda Bogan, Susan Harris, David Kornacker, John Felstiner, Burton Watson, Marian Schwartz, John Biguenet.
PEN translation panel, May 1997: Everett Fox, Kenneth Yasuda, Bronislava Volkov, Edith Grossman, William Weaver, Umberto Eco, Glayfra Ennis, Heda Kovaly, Guido Waldman.
